quiz.question: Diseases that last for short period are called: Chronic diseases <option correct="true>Acute diseases Infectious diseases Non-infectious diseases Acute diseases: short duration (e.g., common cold).
Which is a communicable disease? Diabetes Cancer <option correct="true>Malaria Heart disease Malaria spreads through mosquito bite - communicable.
BCG vaccine prevents: Polio Tetanus <option correct="true>Tuberculosis Measles BCG = Bacillus Calmette-Gu√©rin vaccine for TB.
Vector of malaria is: House fly <option correct="true>Female Anopheles mosquito Male Anopheles mosquito Aedes mosquito Female Anopheles mosquito transmits malaria parasite (Plasmodium).
Which is a water-borne disease? Tuberculosis Common cold <option correct="true>Cholera AIDS Cholera spreads through contaminated water.
Antibiotics work against: Viruses <option correct="true>Bacteria Both bacteria and viruses Fungi Antibiotics target bacteria; antivirals for viruses.
AIDS is caused by: Bacteria Protozoa Fungus <option correct="true>Virus (HIV) AIDS caused by Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV).
Which is NOT a symptom of disease? Fever Cough Headache <option correct="true>Pulse rate Pulse rate is physiological parameter, not disease symptom.
OPV stands for: Oral Polio Vaccine Oral Pertussis Vaccine Oral Pneumonia Vaccine <option correct="true>Oral Polio Vaccine OPV = Oral Polio Vaccine (Sabin vaccine).
Typhoid is caused by: Virus <option correct="true>Bacteria (Salmonella typhi) Protozoa Fungus Typhoid fever caused by Salmonella typhi bacteria.
Which is a viral disease? Tuberculosis Typhoid <option correct="true>Influenza Cholera Influenza (flu) caused by influenza virus.

DPT vaccine prevents: Diphtheria, Polio, Tetanus <option correct="true>Diphtheria, Pertussis, Tetanus Dysentery, Pneumonia, Typhoid Dengue, Polio, Tetanus DPT = Diphtheria, Pertussis (whooping cough), Tetanus.
Dengue is spread by: Anopheles mosquito <option correct="true>Aedes mosquito House fly Rat flea Aedes aegypti mosquito transmits dengue virus.
Which disease affects nervous system? Typhoid Cholera <option correct="true>Polio Malaria Polio virus attacks nervous system causing paralysis.

Health is state of: Absence of disease <option correct="true>Complete physical, mental and social well-being Having good medical facilities Taking medicines regularly WHO definition: Health is complete well-being, not just absence of disease.
Which is a fungal disease? Tuberculosis Typhoid <option correct="true>Ringworm Cholera Ringworm caused by fungi (dermatophytes).
Antibodies are produced by: Red blood cells <option correct="true>White blood cells (lymphocytes) Platelets Liver cells Lymphocytes (WBCs) produce antibodies for immunity.
Sleeping sickness is caused by: Bacteria Virus <option correct="true>Protozoa (Trypanosoma) Fungus African sleeping sickness caused by Trypanosoma protozoan.
MMR vaccine is for: Malaria, Mumps, Rubella <option correct="true>Measles, Mumps, Rubella Meningitis, Malaria, Rabies Measles, Malaria, Rabies MMR = Measles, Mumps, Rubella vaccine.
Which is an air-borne disease? Cholera Typhoid <option correct="true>Tuberculosis AIDS TB spreads through air droplets from cough/sneeze.

Incubation period is: Time for disease to cure Time between infection and appearance of symptoms Time for recovery <option correct="true>Time between infection and appearance of symptoms Incubation period = time from infection to symptom onset.
Rabies affects: Liver Lungs <option correct="true>Nervous system Kidneys Rabies virus attacks central nervous system.
Which is a chronic disease? Common cold <option correct="true>Diabetes Influenza Cholera Chronic diseases last long (diabetes, cancer, heart disease).
Pulse Polio program aims to eradicate: Malaria Tuberculosis <option correct="true>Polio Smallpox Pulse Polio immunization program for polio eradication.
Which mosquito spreads elephantiasis? Anopheles Aedes <option correct="true>Culex Mansonia Culex mosquito transmits filarial worms causing elephantiasis.
